text:
They call it the horse ride
of the sea!

The Jetovator is a new invention
that's just hit NZ shores
for the first time.
We sent our reporter Pere Wihongi

out in to the waters of the
Waitemata for a test drive.
Like riding a horse in the sea.
It's famous world-wide,

but even though
its creator is from NZ,

this is the first time it's reached
the shores of the country.

Luckily we were some of the few
to test drive it first.

I've seen videos on Facebook
with people bigger than me

riding this contraption,
so I should be fine.

There were definitely lows,
but in the end,
things got better.

It's difficult, but after
10 minutes, you get used to it.
The strategy is to lean forward.

And the opportunity
was not going to pass me.
I just had to test it out.
But you'll need to dig deep

as it'll set you back
around $8000-9000.
Nah.

If I had the money
I'd buy one for the family,
but not at the moment.

The market is aimed
at tourism businesses,

but soon enough, it should be
accessible around the nation.
Pere Wihongi, Te Karere.
